author: Eamon Farhat
description: The UK’s National Wealth Fund, along with other investors, is investing more than £600 million ($797 million) as part of a broader funding plan for the country’s grid to fortify infrastructure needed for the clean-energy transition.
title: UK Wealth Fund Pledges £600 Million to Iberdrola to Upgrade Grid

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Masked protesters rushed into the main library at Columbia University on Wednesday to occupy the building, sparking confrontation with the school as it tries to negotiate with the Trump administration to restore federal funding.
title: Columbia University Library Occupied by Pro-Palestine Protesters

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: Niall Ferguson and Fareed Zakaria join this week’s Trumponomics to place Donald Trump’s ambitious plans for the US economy in historical perspective.
title: Looking to Nixon for a Peek at Trump’s Future

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK is drawing up plans to make it harder for migrants to get permanent residency in Britain, as Keir Starmer’s government tries to show progress on cutting immigration.
title: UK Set to Make It Harder for Migrants to Get Permanent Residency

author: Alex Wickham
description: The Israeli Embassy in London was the target of a terror plot by five Iranian nationals who were arrested by British police last weekend, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Israeli Embassy in London Target of Foiled Iranian Terror Plot

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: The controversy over President Donald Trump’s crypto profits is threatening to derail a quick deal on bipartisan stablecoin legislation backed by both the crypto industry and the White House.
title: Trump Memecoin Uproar Complicates Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Deal

author: Ted Mann
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior Washington correspondent Ted Mann looks at how federal spending cuts hit closer to home for millions of Americans. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s and Musk’s Spending Cuts Would Slice Into Cities and States

author: Anthony Capaccio, Roxana Tiron, Julie Johnsson
description: A top US Air Force official said Boeing Co. is proposing to deliver its new version of the Air Force One by 2027 as officials look to satisfy President Donald Trump’s demand for the updated presidential jet before the end of his second term.
title: Boeing Vows to Deliver New Air Force One by 2027, US Official Says

author: Stephanie Lai, Mackenzie Hawkins
description: The Trump administration plans to rescind Biden-era AI chip curbs as part of a broader effort to revise semiconductor trade restrictions that have drawn strong opposition from major tech companies and foreign governments, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Rescind Chip Curbs After Debate Over AI Rules

author: Fares Alghoul, Samy Adghirni
description: Syrian President Ahmed Al-Sharaa said his administration was holding indirect talks with Israel to ease mounting tensions, the first such discussions between the two Middle Eastern neighbors in 17 years.
title: Syrian President Confirms Indirect Israel Talks to Ease Tensions

author: Sara Sjolin
description: Denmark summoned the US ambassador in Copenhagen to discuss alleged espionage against Greenland amid a growing push to gain control of the Arctic island.
title: Denmark Summons US Ambassador Over Reported Espionage Claims

author: Arne Delfs, Maciej Martewicz
description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk pushed back against plans by Germany’s new Chancellor Friedrich Merz to tighten border controls with its European Union neighbors, saying the focus should rather be on reinforcing the bloc’s outside frontier.
title: Merz’s Plans to Tighten Border Checks Face Pushback in Warsaw

author: Flavia Rotondi, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Roman Catholic cardinals gathered at the Vatican in Rome failed to choose a new pope in a ballot Wednesday.
title: Cardinals Fail to Elect New Pope, Conclave Moves On to Next Vote

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said he’s unwilling to preemptively lower tariffs on China in order to unlock more substantive negotiations with Beijing on trade.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Lower China Tariffs to Jump-Start Talks

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chile President Gabriel Boric saw his approval rating plunge to the lowest level of his term amid voter anger over issues such as a surge in organized crime, a poll published on Wednesday showed.
title: Chile’s Boric Sees Approval Rating Hit Lowest Level of His Presidency

author: Nguyen Xuan Quynh, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen
description: Vietnam said Wednesday that it wants its companies to buy more high-value US imports in large volumes and at a stable pace, reaffirming its opening line on trade talks with Washington to avoid punishingly high tariffs.
title: Vietnam Says It Wants to Buy More From US as Trade Talks Begin

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Nigerian senators on Wednesday backed four tax bills that are part of President Bola Tinubu’s efforts to lift government revenue, but joined lawmakers in the lower National Assembly in rejecting his plan to increase the value-added tax rate.
title: Nigeria Senators Approve Tinubu’s Tax Bills But Without Vat Hike

author: Jackie Davalos
description: More than a dozen Democratic senators are demanding Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. reinstate the team responsible for tracking success rates for in vitro fertilization treatments across the country.
title: Democratic Senators Urge RFK Jr. to Reinstate IVF Tracking Team

author: Margi Murphy
description: Three federal departments prohibited their employees from accessing TeleMessage — a message archiving app that former National Security Adviser Michael Waltz used while communicating with other members of the Trump administration — after assessments determined they weren’t secure enough, according to three people familiar with the matter.
title: Message-Archiving App Used by Waltz Banned by Three US Departments

author: Katanga Johnson, Weihua Li
description: Donald Trump’s administration is set to shrink the ranks at the top US financial regulators by more than 2,300 workers, a group that includes bank examiners, criminal investigators and economists.
title: Trump Has Cut Thousands of Wall Street Cops While Markets Wobble

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he’s working with US legislators on outbound investment rules for China that would make clear what’s allowed and what’s not.
title: Bessent Working on Clear Rules for US Investment in China

author: Alberto Nardelli, Andrew Martin
description: Group of Seven leaders may discuss North Korea’s malicious cyber activities and crypto hacks at a summit in Canada next month, according to people familiar with the plans, reflecting mounting global concerns over Pyongyang’s growing online thefts.
title: G-7 Leaders Eye Talks on North Korea’s Crypto Hacks at Summit

author: Ntando Thukwana, S'thembile Cele
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa unveiled the second phase of a reform program aimed at firing up an economy that’s grown by an average of less than 1% annually over the past decade, with measures planned to fix dysfunctional municipalities and drive the adoption of digital technologies.
title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa Unveils New Reforms to Stoke Growth

author: Dan Strumpf
description: India and Pakistan on Wednesday hit each other with military strikes for the sixth time since 1947, when Britain pulled out of the subcontinent and both nations won independence.
title: India’s Global Rise Weighed Down by Perpetual Pakistan Conflict

author: Sam Dagher
description: President Donald Trump’s ceasefire with the Houthis helps ensure a smoother trip to the Middle East next week, with the US pulling back from an ongoing conflict to focus more on business and investment deals.
title: US-Houthi Truce to Help Trump and Gulf Allies Focus on Business

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: The US is shifting its focus away from a 30-day ceasefire in Russia’s war with Ukraine toward shaping a long-term peace settlement, Vice President JD Vance said.
title: US Focused on Long-Term Ukraine Peace, Not Ceasefire, Vance Says

author: Prashant Gopal
description: Mass cuts in the federal workforce have triggered a record spike in housing inventory in Washington’s real estate market.
title: Homes for Sale in DC Surge by Record as DOGE Job Cuts Take Hold

author: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago
description: The 84-year-old mother of opposition leader María Corina Machado escaped Venezuela in an operation tied to the US-brokered exit of five political aides who were hiding in the Argentine Embassy in Caracas, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Machado’s Mother Flees Venezuela Amid ‘Impeccable’ US Operation

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain’s high-earning electricity executives should pay the cost to keep nuclear plants running if they don’t want to shut them down, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said, as he seeks to deflect criticism over a record power outage.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Tells ‘Ultra-Rich’ Executives to Pay for Nuclear

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia’s federal budget deficit surged in April as declining oil revenue and rising military spending continue to strain government finances.
title: Russia’s Budget Gap Widens as Oil Revenue Drops for Third Month

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Cracks are starting to appear as Javier Milei removes the distortions that once characterized the Argentine economy, hurting companies that bulked up on debt by exploiting exchange rate gaps.
title: Corporate Defaults Start Piling Up in Argentina as Milei Policies Kick In

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy will increase its defense spending to reach NATO’s target of 2% of gross domestic product this year, Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said.
title: Italy to Reach 2% Defense Spending Target This Year, Meloni Says

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK has named China as the dominant threat to national cybersecurity after a series of hacks and breaches involving British government departments and critical infrastructure.
title: UK Cyber Security Chief Names China as Dominant Hacking Threat

description: Unwelcome reminders from the worst days of Venezuela’s economic crisis in 2019 are starting to crop up once again: rolling blackouts, triple-digit inflation and a foreign currency crunch.
title: Blackouts, 162% Inflation Remind Venezuelans of Worst of Crisis

author: Ari Natter
description: House Republicans have added a plan to raise billions of dollars to help pay for US President Donald Trump’s massive tax cuts through the sale of thousands of acres of federal land — a politically charged idea that has drawn opposition from some in their own party.
title: Republicans to Pay for Trump Tax Cuts With Sales of Public Land

author: Teresa Xie
description: In this year’s hotly contested race for New Jersey governor, some Democratic hopefuls are embracing a strategy that helped propel Republican Donald Trump back to the White House: They support crypto, and they’re not afraid to say it.
title: New Jersey Democrats Warm Up to Crypto in Crowded Governor’s Race

author: Arne Delfs, Samy Adghirni
description: New German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and French President Emmanuel Macron pledged to reset ties between their nations and join forces to help strengthen the European Union’s defensive capabilities and competitiveness.
title: Merz and Macron Vow to Reset Franco-German Ties to Strengthen EU

author: Keith Naughton
description: Long gone are the days when an imported car meant a foreign car. And no company proves the point more than General Motors Co.
title: American Car, Made in Korea: Why GM Is Getting Roiled by Tariffs

author: Simon Marks, Mohammed Alamin
description: A major Sudanese naval base was targeted by armed drones, the fourth such raid on the Red Sea coast in as many days, as authorities struggle to tame a blaze at a nearby port that’s crucial to the flow of humanitarian aid.
title: Sudan Naval Base on Red Sea Targeted in New Phase of Civil War

author: Colum Murphy, Yujing Liu, Fran Wang, Rebecca Choong Wilkins, Josh Xiao
description: President Xi Jinping’s government provided a jolt to China’s economy ahead of landmark trade talks with the US, with officials unveiling a range of policies designed to strengthen Beijing’s hand in negotiations.
title: Xi Fortifies China’s Economy Before First Talks on Trade With US

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union will propose tariffs on Boeing Co. aircraft if talks with the US meant to de-escalate the trade conflict fail, according to a person familiar with the plan, who spoke on the condition of anonymity.
title: EU Plans to Hit Boeing With Tariffs If US Trade Talks Fail

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romanians delivered a resounding anti-establishment message in the first round of the country’s presidential election rerun, propelling hard-right leader George Simion and Bucharest’s independent centrist mayor Nicusor Dan to a high-stakes runoff to be held on May 18.
title: Romania’s Election Rerun: What’s at Stake as the Far Right Rises

author: Julian Lee
description: In the four weeks to May 4 shipments were worth the least since April 2, 2023
title: Value of Russia’s Oil Exports Hits Two-Year Low in Budget Blow

author: Ted Mann, Shawn Donnan, Nazmul Ahasan
description: Officials are confronting deep uncertainty about funding for programs that undergird their economies — just as Trump’s trade war has raised fears of a recession.
title: States, Cities Face Funding Collapse Threat with Trump Cuts

description: Un par de meses con sanciones más duras de la administración Trump han hecho que vuelvan a surgir las proyecciones de una recesión en el país.
title: Crisis en Venezuela: apagones y presión cambiaria reavivan fantasmas del colapso de 2019

author: Rebecca Choong Wilkins
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi Promotes His Vision of Waning US Influence

author: David Herbling
description: Kenyan President William Ruto plans to scrap some tax breaks to help shore up the state’s coffers, a change in strategy that comes after proposals to introduce new levies sparked deadly protests and nearly toppled his government last year before they were abandoned.
title: Kenyan Leader Ruto Switches Tack on Taxes After Deadly Protests

author: Martin Ritchie, Qizi Sun
description: For more than 20 years, Chinese entrepreneur Sandy Zeng built a pet products business selling feeding bowls and toys to American homes. He’s now looking hard at cats and dogs in other markets.
title: China’s Factories Start to Imagine World Without American Buyers

author: Miranda Davis
description: The contest to replace the retiring Senator Dick Durbin of Illinois continues to get more competitive as a prominent critic of President Donald Trump enters what promises to be a crowded 2026 Democratic primary.
title: Raja Krishnamoorthi Enters Illinois Senate Race for Dick Durbin’s Seat

author: Josh Xiao
description: Chinese imposed levies on an insecticide shipped from India in what state media said is a signal that it would punish countries trying to cut deals with the US at Beijing’s expense.
title: China Signals India Levy Is a Warning on Cutting Deals With US

author: Piotr Skolimowski
description: Former US President Joe Biden said the Donald Trump administration is appeasing Kremlin leader Vladimir Putin by pressuring Ukraine to give up territory as part of a potential peace deal to end Russia’s invasion.
title: Biden Slams Trump Over ‘Modern Day Appeasement’ in Ukraine

author: Haslinda Amin, Lulu Shen
description: Expectations are high that trade talks between US and Chinese officials in Switzerland later this week will result in a tariff reprieve between the two nations, US-China Business Council President Sean Stein said.
title: US-China Tariff Pause Reasonable to Expect, Council Head Says

author: Stephen Stapczynski
description: Talks between Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin this week will include negotiations around a much-delayed natural gas pipeline connecting the two economies, reviving discussions hampered for years by disagreements on the cost, route and urgency of the project.
title: China and Russia Put Stalled Gas Pipeline on Moscow Talks Agenda

author: Anisah Shukry
description: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli said he is prepared to step down from the cabinet to focus on campaigning for the next general election that’s due in 2028.
title: Malaysia Economy Minister Rafizi Says Ready to Quit Cabinet

author: Iain Rogers
description: Friedrich Merz travels to Paris and Warsaw on Wednesday on his first foreign trip as German chancellor, still reeling from a humiliating setback in Tuesday’s government transition that raised early questions about his leadership.
title: Merz Heads to Paris and Warsaw After Chaotic Start as Chancellor

author: April Ma, Zheng Wu
description: China’s top securities regulator has become a surprising addition to the chorus of voices praising Warren Buffett, after the legendary investor announced his plan to step down as chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway Inc.
title: Chinese Regulator Applauds Warren Buffett’s Long-Term Approach

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: South Korea’s former acting leader and current presidential hopeful Han Duck-soo vowed Wednesday to launch a new ministry to oversee the country’s artificial intelligence strategies and science innovation if he wins the election.
title: South Korea Presidential Hopeful Han Vows to Create AI Ministry

author: Shinhye Kang
description: South Korea’s high court delayed its first hearing on leading presidential candidate Lee Jae-myung’s election violation case until June 18, two weeks after the election date, ensuring he will be able to run for the country’s top office.
title: South Korea Court to Hear Presidential Lead Candidate’s Case After Polls

author: John Harney
description: A Trump administration task force on antisemitism said Tuesday that it will review Gaza-related protests and vandalism at the University of Washington targeting Boeing Co. and a new engineering building the company helped fund.
title: US Antisemitism Probe Hits Anti-Boeing Acts on Seattle Campus

author: Souhail Karam, Michael Gunn
description: The territory of Western Sahara is turning into an ‘El Dorado’ after the US recognized Morocco’s claim over the region.
title: A Remote and Disputed Corner of Africa is Cheering Trump

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Flavia Rotondi
description: Roman Catholic cardinals from across the globe are heading to the Sistine Chapel to choose a new pope, who will set the moral compass for the Church’s 1.4 billion faithful and become a reference point for much of the world.
title: Conclave for a New Pope Begins With Faithful Seeking Direction

author: Andra Timu, Patrick Donahue
description: Romania’s far-right leader, the resounding first-round winner of the nation’s presidential election, said he found inspiration in Argentina’s chainsaw-wielding president when asked about how he would address the country’s economic woes.
title: Romanian Far-Right Trump Acolyte Plans Milei-Style Spending Cuts

author: Vladimir Kuznetsov
description: Russia’s air defense shot down nine drones flying toward Moscow, the capital’s mayor said, in an incident coming just before foreign leaders including the presidents of China and Brazil are expected in the city for Victory Day celebrations.
title: Moscow Shot Down Drones for Third Day as Xi, Lula Due to Arrive

author: Swati Gupta
description: Two weeks after a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir on April 22, India announced that it had conducted “precise and restrained” strikes on what it called “terrorist camps” in neighboring Pakistan. Pakistan said it had shot down five Indian planes in retaliation.
title: What’s Behind the Enduring India-Pakistan Conflict?

author: Weilun Soon
description: Container liners are starting to sever shipping routes that link the US and China across the Pacific, as President Donald Trump’s trade war upends the industry and forces the two largest economies apart.
title: World’s Trade Superhighway Feels Strain From US-China Decoupling

author: Matthew Brockett
description: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis sought a meeting with former Reserve Bank Governor Adrian Orr to discuss bank capital requirements in the weeks prior to his sudden resignation, documents released under the Official Information Act show.
title: NZ’s Willis Sought Meeting on Bank Capital Before Orr Quit RBNZ

author: Claire Jiao, Grace Sihombing
description: While Indonesia’s economic growth was largely expected to slow in the first quarter, few predicted a key drag would come from President Prabowo Subianto’s new government.
title: Prabowo’s Transition Pains Emerge as Drag on Indonesian Growth
